result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 2:09pm 
Defendant Scott A Smith appears via videoconferencing from Oshkosh Correctional Institution, in custody.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Smith makes a statement regarding upcoming alcohol and drug counseling-programming that he has recently enrolled in.  
After discussion with the parties, the Court denies the Petition for Sentence Adjustment. The Court encourages Mr. Smith to make good efforts in the intended programming.  
recess  2:18pm.
Set Hearing

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 2:06pm. 
Defendant Scott A Smith in court, in custody, with Attorney Samantha J Humes.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The maximum penalties are recited. 
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.  
Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ. The victim M. W. makes a statement.  
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Humes. Mr. Smith makes a statement.

The Court sentences Mr. Smith to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any other sentence in being. .  
The Court finds that Mr. Smith is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Smith is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 392 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision those conditions that were originally ordered as conditions of Probation [which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--no possesssion of any controlled substances without a prescription
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no direct/indirect contact with Marilyn WIld
--the defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety
--the defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol
--the defendant shall not be present in any bar, tavern or liquor store
--the defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia
--the defendant shall not engage in any acts or threats of violence
--to pay the balance due on court financial obligations
--to pay the balance due on restitution of $2377.50 payable to Marilyn Wild (this amount is related to both this case and read-in case #15CF405)
--to pay the balance due on restitution of $175 payable to Junk & Disorderly (victim in 16JE754) related to the uncharged read-in referral]
recess: 2:34pm
Attorney Humes
cc: DA (electronically) certified copy by COC on 5-3-18 MG

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CF405 & 15CF427 called together at 8:18 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Scott A Smith in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall confirms victim rights compliance, submits victim impact statement & informs the Court that Miss Wild is present and wishes to address the Court
Court finds Chapter 950 compliance

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered to charge in 15CF427; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #
15CF405, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses uncharged referral 16JE746 (dov: 2/29/16) theft, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred
Statements by Marilyn Wild; Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

To the charge in Case 15CF427, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, and adopts the conditions as set forth in the criminal case settlement form, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment per Agent
--No possesssion of any controlled substances without a prescription
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--Fine and/or costs
--DNA Surcharge
--Other costs/fees
--No direct/indirect contact with Marilyn WIld
--The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety
--The defendant shall not be present in any bar, tavern or liquor store
--The defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia
--The defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol
--The defendant shall not engage in any acts or threats of violence
--Restitution of $2377.50 payable to Marilyn Wild (15CF427 & 15CF405)
--Restitution of $175 payable to Junk & Disorderly (victim in 16JE754) uncharged read-in

EXCEPT THE COURT ORDERS INSTEAD OF 30 DAYS JAIL:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, withOUT Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
Court determines that Mr. Smith has previously submitted a DNA Sample and does not order one to be taken


Days credit for time already served: 117 days
